title: How many marks must I get to pass? - Quora

response.answer_text: As many as it takes to get a passing grade. Marks are calculated on a “did the student pass or not” scale. Whether or not you get a passing grade depends on where your score falls on the scale. If you get enough marks to fall into the “this student passed” section of the “did the student pass or not” scale, then you will have passed the test. If you don’t get enough marks to fall into the “this student passed” section of the “did the student pass or not” scale, then you will not have passed the test. The goal is to get enough marks to pass.

It depends on how tough was the exam,As to be pass we need to get more than cut off marks. 2017 CUT OFFS Category = Cut-off Marks General = 81 OBC-NCL = 49 Scheduled Caste = 32 Scheduled Tribe = 27 PWD = 01 You can compare the 2017 Exam paper to see Is it Tough for you or not..and can you get sufficient marks.
May be 100 out of 28 is the passing marks
